title: Getting Started
content:
Welcome # This guide will help you to get started with Econumo. It will provide you with the basic information about the application and explain the main concepts and motivation behind it.
Econumo’s concept # I started using money tracker applications in 2008. I have tried many applications, and used some of them for a long time. You may wonder why I changed them? There were few reasons, which might apply to you as well:
I switched from Iphone to Android. I travelled to other countries and needed a tool to track expenses in different currencies. At some point I realized that I need a budgeting tool, not just a money tracker. I married and needed a tool for the family budgeting and planning which supports different platforms. The last app we used had a bug in the sync/backup process, and we lost all the data without the ability to recover it. In September 2020, after the data loss, I decided to create my own money tracker, which will:
Have a simple and intuitive interface. Be available on all platforms. Support multiple currencies. Support multiple users. Have a budgeting tool. Be open-source and can be self-hosted. This is how Econumo started. I hope you will find it useful for your needs as well.
Contents # The guide consists of the following sections:
Getting Started Editions Open Source FAQ

title: v0.1.0 Econumo Release
content:
The first public release of Econumo.
Econumo One: v0.1.0 Econumo Family: v0.1.0

title: Econumo Editions
content:
Econumo Editions # Econumo provides versatile editions to meet various needs:
Econumo CLOUD # Suited for individuals and families seeking convenience and access, this cloud-hosted solution offers a comprehensive suite of financial management tools available anytime, anywhere.
Econumo FAMILY # Designed for households needing a self-hosted, collaborative approach, this platform supports up to 10 users, ensuring everyone stays aligned financially.
Econumo ONE # Tailored for solo users who prefer a self-hosted solution, this free platform delivers powerful financial management features for those who prioritize privacy and control over their budgeting.
To get started with Econumo One, please follow the instructions on the GitHub repository.

title: Multi-Currency support
content:
Multi-Currency Support # Econumo offers multi-currency functionality. To get started, you need to:
Load currencies into your Econumo instance. Set up a daily update for currency rates. To simplify this process, we have developed a tool that updates currencies and exchange rates using data from https://openexchangerates.org.
You can find the tool here: https://github.com/econumo/currency-loader
Installation # Register at https://openexchangerates.org and generate your API keys. Clone the repository or download the binary file from the releases page. Copy a .env.example to .env and update the configuration as needed. Run the tool to load currencies and their exchange rates into your Econumo instance. Enjoy!

title: Contact us
content:
Contact us # Please use GitHub discussions to talk about the roadmap, features, and bugs.
For billing-related inquiries or partnership opportunities, email econumo@gmail.com.

title: FAQ
content:
Frequently Asked Questions # Do you have plans to add automated import of transactions from banks? # Automated import of transactions from banks and other sources is not a priority at this point. However, it might be added in the future as an optional feature.
If you have development skills and want to contribute, you are welcome to do so by using Econumo’s API.

title: Open Source
content:
Open Source # The self-hosted version of Econumo includes two components: the Frontend and the Backend (API and Database), all contained within a single Docker image.
Backend (API) # The backend (API) is open-source under the AGPLv3 license and can be found on Github. It is written in PHP and uses the Symfony framework with SQLite as a database.
Frontend # The frontend is not open-source, but it is included in the Econumo app. Additionally, you can find the distribution here.
